title: The Zero Product Property
text: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.
speech: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.
pacedSpeech: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.

title: Factoring the Equation
text: To factor this equation, we must expand and re-factor. $$\left(p-5\right) \left(p+3\right)=p^2-2p-15$$. So, we have $$p^2-2p-8=0$$. Factoring this, we get $$\left(p-4\right) \left(p+2\right)=0$$
speech: To factor this equation, we must expand and re-factor.  parentheses p minus 5,  times, parentheses p plus 3,  is equal to p squared minus 2 p minus 15 . So, we have  p squared, minus 2 p minus 8 is equal to 0 . Factoring this, we get  parentheses p minus 4,  times, parentheses p plus 2,  is equal to 0
pacedSpeech: To factor this equation, we must expand and re-factor.    p minus 5,  times,  p plus 3,  is equal to p squared minus 2 p minus 15
. So, we have   p squared, minus 2 p minus 8 is equal to 0
. Factoring this, we get    p minus 4,  times,  p plus 2,  is equal to 0

title: Using the Zero Product Property
text: As per the zero product property, if $$\left(p-4\right) \left(p+2\right)=0$$, then either $$p-4$$ or $$p+2$$ is equal to $$0$$. Setting both of these to $$0$$, $$p=4$$ and $$p=-2$$. Summing these values, we get $$2$$
speech: As per the zero product property, if  parentheses p minus 4,  times, parentheses p plus 2,  is equal to 0 , then either  p, minus 4  or  p, plus, 2  is equal to  0 . Setting both of these to  0 ,  p is equal to 4  and  p, is equal to, negative 2 . Summing these values, we get  2
